page.title: 06Navigation Farm Lt. Haywood
page.content: Navigation Farm is no longer a working farm. The land has been sold to another local farmer, and the farmhouse is now used as student accomodation for the College students in Stafford. The farmhouse is situated beyond the railway line from Colwich to Stoke, and beside the Trent and Mersey Canal. It was formerly a canal side Inn, where the Bargees could obtain refreshment and stable their horses for the night. The North Staffordshire Railway had a delivery arrangement with the Inn. Barrels of Beer were shunted from Colwich Junction and rolled down on incline to the Inn. It may be that heather gathered on nearby Cannock Chase was loaded here and carried to Stoke, where it was used as a packing material for crates of pottery.
